sentences.sContent: ...a disappointing holiday season performance that capped a difficult year for a department store chain facing wide-ranging challenges...
...good databases did not exist; grant funders were not pushing for sharing; it has been difficult to agree on standards for formatting data; and there is no agreed way to assign credit for data...
...it’s difficult for other people to break into it，” said Po-Shen Loh...
...Google and Apple have made it far too difficult to adjust these settings so it's up to us to take steps ensure we set these triggers to suit our own needs...
...if a student meets a difficult question about their major...
...while acknowledging that "this has been an area that is difficult to navigate...
...Especially if it's difficult for a competitor to copy...
...Wilhelm said the excess of labels made it difficult for businesses and consumers to know which labels they should pay attention to...

synos.tran: 困难的；不随和的；执拗的

phrases.pCn: 问题地区；特殊土地区；非凡土地区

trans.tranOther: someone who is difficult never seems pleased or satisfied
